Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial of Antithrombotic Regimens in Peripheral Arterial Disease

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants included individuals with PAD, defined by symptoms, previous procedures, or objective evidence of malperfusion.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved various antithrombotic regimens compared to placebo or other regimens.

Objective.evidence: This study aims to evaluate the efficacy and risks of antithrombotic regimens in preventing major cardiovascular events, vascular limb events, and mortality in PAD patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was a composite of major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE) and major adverse limb events (MALE) over the longest reported follow-up.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Data were extracted and analysed using intention-to-treat principles.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome showed a significant reduction in MACE and MALE with certain antithrombotic regimens.

Harms.evidence: Adverse events, including major bleeding, were reported, with varying frequencies across regimens.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The study was registered with PROSPERO (CRD42023389262).

Funding.evidence: The study's funding source was not specified.
